main event: An object was observed climbing rapidly and steadily toward the zenith, passing directly overhead, in Elmendorf, Alaska on October 6, 1957.
interesting points: The object was described as a single, white point of reflected light.
The report suggests it could have been a satellite, aircraft, balloon, meteor, or missile.
Six qualified observers from the 514th Air Intelligence Service Squadron made the observation.
Two photos were taken with a Leica 35mm camera, which were to be immediately airmailed.
Weather conditions were reported as optimal, with a full moon and high thin cirrus clouds.
sighted object: a single white point of reflected light
witnesses: six qualified observers from the 514th Air Intelligence Service Squadron
photographs: yes, two photos were taken with a Leica 35mm camera
